vision.notes: Round eyes are a characteristic of the family. Likely used for prey detection and navigation.

olfaction.notes: Females release chemical signals to attract males for mating, indicating a well-developed sense of smell.

electroreception.notes: Sharks possess ampullae of Lorenzini, allowing them to detect electrical fields in the water. This is a common trait in sharks and likely present in this family.

mechanoreception.notes: The lateral line system is used to detect vibrations and pressure changes in the water, aiding in prey detection and spatial awareness.
